definition[0]: the government tax that is put on the goods that are produced and used inside a country
definition[1]: to remove or get rid of something, especially by cutting it out
definition[2]: a government tax that is charged on certain goods that are sold in the country, for example alcoholic drinks and petrol
example[2]: An excise on home production of tobacco could have produced the same revenue as a tax on imports.
example[3]: The Chancellor decided not to increase excise on whisky.
example[4]: an excise officer  (=someone who collects excise)
definition[3]: in Britain, a group of government officials whose job is to collect excise and some other taxes
